title: Does throat singing limit your vocal range? - Quora

response.answer_text: What do you *mean by “throat singing?” Here’s a little info: In International Italianate terms (in English here), we refer to “chest voice,” because sensations felt in the chest on lower notes and in the speaking voice (I think this is what you mean by throat singing?). “Head voice” is used on mid/high notes, and sensations are felt more in the head. IF you carry the pure chest voice up too high (using the heavy speaking voice muscles and adjustment), then YES, your range will be very limited; also you can damage the voice and you will likely make a sound that’s not desireable. To improve and explore this further, study singing with an experienced teacher who has academic credentials. *NOTE: “Throat singing” refers to a special technique practiced by the Tuvan people of Mongolia :) Tuvan throat singing - Wikipedia

Yes it does. Quite severely in fact. Throat singing can be very damaging and put enormous strain on your vocal cords when you sing resulting in vocal nodes, and overblown vocal folds. Short answer is I wouldn’t recommend it at all. Learn open throat singing instead.
